results.title: Energy
results.creator_credit: Barbara Buce, Arthur G. Evans and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Explores energy in humans, animals, the elements and the earth. Shows how these kinds of energy are harnessed and how they are used daily in home and industry. Shows that pollution is a result of excessive use and barren devastation is a result of a lack of conservation. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Electrical safety
results.brief_description: Presents five rules for using electricity safely and offers examples of the wrong ways of handling electricity based on these rules. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Crafts in Australia
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australia Council
results.brief_description: This is a semi-promotional film made for the Crafts Council of Australia. Shows Australian craftsmen and women and their ideas, motivation and life style. Mirka Mora briefly features.

results.title: The Apes
results.brief_description: This film looks at physical characteristics, habits and behaviour of the gibbon, chimpanzee, orangutan and gorilla. It shows how each ape is adapted to its physical environment and why the apes and their environment are endangered.
results.description: This film looks at physical characteristics, habits and behaviour of the gibbon, chimpanzee, orangutan and gorilla. It shows how each ape is adapted to its physical environment and why the apes and their environment are endangered.

results.title: About zoos
results.creator_credit: Christine Z Wiser, Harry Rasky, N. H. Cominos and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Edited from the 1970 television special titled Zoos of the world. Explains that modern zoos around the world provide many services for animals, including places where they can graze, dig, climb, swim and sleep with protection and with nursery and medical care. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.

results.title: Behaviour patterns and survival
results.brief_description: Depicts the behaviour of the Slaty Backed Gull. Types of chick behaviour, innate and learned are shown by response to parent’s voice. Originally in Japanese - dubbed into English. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Erosion of our land
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: An examination of four areas of New Zealand that are troubled by problems of erosion and the attempts made by farmers and others to ensure better use of the land.

results.title: The Cat's meow
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Oxford Scientific Films
results.brief_description: A live action cat-and-mouse story about several playful mice, an inquisitive house cat, and his cousin, the alley cat, which is shown as a serious struggle for survival and a comic standoff between lively opponents. Suitable for upper primary level.
